content:
Diagnosis
	1. Rectal adenocarcinoma, Duke's C2 (T3N2M1)
	Initially diagnosed March 2023
	BRAF V600E mutation positive
	PIK3CA mutation detected
	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Apr 2023 Anterior resection with primary anastomosis

	Chemotherapy
	1. FOLFOX/Bevacizumab May-Oct 2023
	2. FOLFIRI/Cetuximab Nov 2023-Mar 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease in liver

	Current issues
	Fatigue, right upper quadrant pain

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today following recent CT showing disease progression in liver with new lesions. Previous CT in January 2024 had shown stable disease on FOLFIRI/Cetuximab. Latest scan shows 3 new liver lesions and growth of existing lesions (largest increased from 3.2cm to 4.8cm). Performance status remains 1 but experiencing increased right upper quadrant pain requiring regular opiates.

Blood tests show rising CEA from 45 to 180 over 6 weeks. Liver function remains stable. No new safety concerns.

Given progression on two lines of therapy and presence of BRAF V600E mutation, we will now commence third-line treatment with BRAF-targeted therapy combination (Encorafenib/Cetuximab).

	Further investigations
	CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 8 weeks
	Weekly LFTs for first 4 weeks

	Medication prescribed
	Encorafenib 300mg daily
	Cetuximab 500mg/m2 every 2 weeks

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 2 weeks with blood tests

	Required GP actions
	Weekly blood tests including LFTs for first 4 weeks
	Monitor pain control requirements
